session_goal: Debug Google Calendar not displaying events after connecting
changes_summary: Diagnosed Google Calendar sync failure. Auth popup works (user can connect) but events don't display. Root cause: Supabase Edge Functions (google-auth-exchange, google-auth-refresh) are deployed but missing GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET secrets. Google returns 'invalid_client' error on token exchange. No source files modified — this is a configuration issue.
decisions_made: Edge Functions are deployed and reachable (not 404)
Google returns invalid_client — Edge Function missing GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET Supabase secret
User needs to get client secret from Google Cloud Console and set it as Supabase secret
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY was added to alpha-ai .env and OpenClaw container restarted successfully

continuation.next_immediate_step: User provides Google Client Secret from Google Cloud Console, then set Supabase secrets via CLI or Dashboard
next_three_steps: Set GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET as Supabase Edge Function secrets
Re-test Google Calendar connection — events should sync after token exchange works
Harden SSH on desktop (Task #10 — requires sudo)
blockers: GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET needed from Google Cloud Console (user must retrieve)
SSH hardening requires sudo at desktop
